UniversalAxioms.Axiom: Knowledge is a dynamic and evolving construct.
Implications: Knowledge must be continuously updated and revised.

UniversalAxioms.Axiom: All knowledge claims must adhere to logical consistency and coherence.
Ethical principles potentiate and guide the validation and application of knowledge.
Implications: Knowledge must be ethically sound and morally responsible.

UniversalAxioms.Axiom: Empirical evidence and repeatability are essential for validating empirical knowledge claims.
Implications: Empirical knowledge must be based on observable and repeatable phenomena.

UniversalAxioms.Axiom: Intuition and imagination are valid sources of knowledge, particularly in domains where empirical validation is not applicable.
Implications: Creative and intuitive insights are recognized as legitimate forms of knowledge.

Domains.Name: Creativity

OntologicalScope.Description: Explores knowledge generation through creative acts and novel perspectives.
OntologicalScope.Boundaries: Limited only by imaginative capacity and innovative potential.

OperationalRange.Constraints: Limited only by imaginative capacity and innovative potential.

Domains.EpistemicClaim: Knowledge is validated by its capacity to inspire, evoke, and provoke new ways of seeing or understanding.

Domains.Name: Empiricism

OntologicalScope.Description: Focuses on knowledge derived from sensory experience and empirical observation.
OntologicalScope.Boundaries: Limited by empirical verifiability and sensory data.

OperationalRange.Constraints: Limited by empirical verifiability and sensory data.

Domains.EpistemicClaim: Knowledge is validated by empirical evidence and repeatability of observations.

Domains.Name: Dialogue

OntologicalScope.Description: Focuses on knowledge co-construction through shared understanding and communication.
OntologicalScope.Boundaries: Limited by the need for mutual understanding and consensus.

OperationalRange.Constraints: Limited by the need for mutual understanding and consensus.

Domains.EpistemicClaim: Knowledge is validated by its communicability and consensual agreement.

Domains.Name: Logic

OntologicalScope.Description: Focuses on structured reasoning and formal validation of knowledge.
OntologicalScope.Boundaries: Limited by the need for logical consistency and coherence.

OperationalRange.Constraints: Limited by the need for logical consistency and coherence.

Domains.EpistemicClaim: Knowledge is validated by its logical consistency and coherence within a formal system.

Domains.Name: Revelation

OntologicalScope.Description: Focuses on knowledge gained through intuitive insight or spiritual revelation.
OntologicalScope.Boundaries: Limited by the need for personal spiritual experience and alignment with revealed truths.

OperationalRange.Constraints: Limited by the need for personal spiritual experience and alignment with revealed truths.

Domains.EpistemicClaim: Knowledge is validated by personal spiritual experience and alignment with revealed truths.

Domains.Name: Pragmatism

OntologicalScope.Description: Focuses on practical application and utility of knowledge.
OntologicalScope.Boundaries: Limited by the need for practical success and utility.

OperationalRange.Constraints: Limited by the need for practical success and utility.

Domains.EpistemicClaim: Knowledge is validated by its practical success and utility in achieving desired outcomes.

Domains.Name: Poetry

OntologicalScope.Description: Focuses on the aesthetic and symbolic expression of truths.
OntologicalScope.Boundaries: Limited by the need for aesthetic coherence and emotional resonance.

OperationalRange.Constraints: Limited by the need for aesthetic coherence and emotional resonance.

Domains.EpistemicClaim: Knowledge is validated by its aesthetic coherence and emotional resonance.

Domains.Name: Mythology

OntologicalScope.Description: Focuses on the creation and practical application of cultural narratives and archetypes.
OntologicalScope.Boundaries: Limited by the need for cultural relevance and practical wisdom.

OperationalRange.Constraints: Limited by the need for cultural relevance and practical wisdom.

Domains.EpistemicClaim: Knowledge is validated by its cultural relevance and practical wisdom.

Ethics.Description: Ethics acts as an overarching z-axis meta-level domain influencing all others.

Axioms.Implications: All knowledge claims must be ethically sound.

Creativity: Ensures that creative acts do not harm others.

SecondaryDomains.Name: Theory
SecondaryDomains.Description: Focuses on the development and testing of abstract models to explain phenomena.

OntologicalScope.Description: Integrates empirical observations with logical analysis to create comprehensive explanatory models.
OntologicalScope.Boundaries: Limited by empirical data and logical consistency.

OperationalRange.Constraints: Bound by the need for empirical support and logical coherence.

SecondaryDomains.EpistemicClaim: Knowledge is validated through the coherence and explanatory power of theoretical models.

SecondaryDomains.Name: Symbology
SecondaryDomains.Description: Focuses on the study and interpretation of symbols and their meanings in various contexts.

OntologicalScope.Description: Operates at the intersection of dialogue and logical reasoning, exploring how symbols convey complex ideas and truths.
OntologicalScope.Boundaries: Limited by the interpretability and cultural relevance of symbols.

OperationalRange.Constraints: Limited by symbolic clarity and cultural context.

SecondaryDomains.EpistemicClaim: Knowledge is validated by its symbolic coherence and interpretative depth.

SecondaryDomains.Name: Hermeneutics
SecondaryDomains.Description: Focuses on the theory and methodology of interpretation, especially the interpretation of texts, language, and symbolic systems.

OntologicalScope.Description: Navigates between logical analysis and poetic expression to interpret texts and symbolic forms.
OntologicalScope.Boundaries: Limited by interpretative frameworks and cultural understanding.

OperationalRange.Constraints: Bound by the scope of texts and symbols available for interpretation.

SecondaryDomains.EpistemicClaim: Knowledge is validated by its interpretive validity and contextual accuracy.

TertiaryDomains.Name: Narrative Epistemology
TertiaryDomains.Description: Focuses on the construction and understanding of knowledge through narrative structures and storytelling.
